SEARCH
Package game.dialogue

Class Dialogue

java.lang.Object
game.dialogue.Dialogue
public class Dialogue extends Object
Represents a structured dialogue system between a player and an NPC.

The dialogue consists of multiple rounds, each containing a set of options the player can choose from, and corresponding responses from the NPC. The dialogue progresses by moving to the next round after a response.

Author:
Mohanad Al-Mansoob

  • Constructor Details

    • Dialogue

      public Dialogue(List<List<String>> options, List<List<String>> responses)
      Constructs a new Dialogue instance with specified player options and NPC responses.
      Parameters:
      options - the list of options available to the player per round
      responses - the list of NPC responses per round, matched to player options

  • Method Details

    • getCurrentOptions

      public List<String> getCurrentOptions()
      Returns the list of options available to the player in the current round.
      Returns:
      a list of options for the current round, or an empty list if the dialogue is finished

    • getResponseFor

      public String getResponseFor(int optionIndex)
      Returns the NPC's response corresponding to the player's selected option.
      Parameters:
      optionIndex - the index of the chosen option
      Returns:
      the NPC's response, or a default message if the index is out of bounds

    • nextRound

      public void nextRound()
      Advances the dialogue to the next round.

    • isFinished

      public boolean isFinished()
      Returns whether the dialogue has finished (i.e., no more options left).
      Returns:
      true if the dialogue has finished, false otherwise
